title: Rito, where are you?
body: Haven't seen any Riot comments in a while. Looking through the red tracker, it seems that a good majority of Riot activity occurs mostly on their own posts. No red at all on the front page other than the pinned posts. Rito, we need you. {{item:3070}} {{champion:32}} {{item:3070}}

replies.body: A lot of us are out and about on the weekends! For example, Baconhawk and myself did a 5k! :D
Katey your the only one i ever see here...

> Katey your the only one i ever see here...

Yea and she's completely useless gj riot

Yeah let's get a Rioter that plays with the community to work on game balance and bugs!

And i thought Bronze were stupid, you are Diamond seriously...

Nope. If I had to guess, you guys dismissed the community management team in NA, created the All Chat (good try in my opinion) and redirected the NA community workload to other Riot Teams. If it isn't 100% like I have said, it is something along these lines.

You're statement is a little misinformed.

Contrary to popular belief, Riot actually doesn't interact with the community at all. They have sophisticated bots that are programed to imitate real people. They dedicate about half their NA servers to maintaining this facade, which is why they're always so laggy.
You can actually test this.
- Bacon Hawk always shows up when Bacon is mentioned.
- Stashu responds to all topics about Cassiopia, but always uses a near cookie-cutter response about how great she is now.
- Scarizard only comments about how much he regrets the Skarma Rework.
- Phreak's posts all contain "TONS OF DAMAGE!".
- Morello only talks about nerfs.
- Pwyff is the dedicated patch bot. You never see it anywhere else.

Of course, they also have some bots that appear as normal forum users to defend them and help throw off the scent.
Like me for example.

Signed,
~ Reverse-psychology bot conspiracy inc.
